### [Dealing with ordinal data](ordinal_data.html)

* A description of why ordinal regressions are useful and how to use them.
* Code for producing useful visualisations of ordinal data.

* Information about my drop-in R seminars, being trialed in September 2018.

* Official page for the *Adventures In R* workshop.

### [Setting up RStudio](1_Setting_Up.nb.html)

* A very introductory description of how to get RStudio set up in advance of a tutorial or workshop.

### [Reporting statistics in prose](prose_statistics.nb.html)

* A tutorial on how to find the numbers one typically needs to report when conducting certain statistical tests.
* Includes examples of wording for writing about statistical tests in academic prose.

### [Using and graphing prop.test()](forced_choice.nb.html)

* Some quick snippets and instructions for performing 1-sample proportions tests.
* Base graphics code for producing stacked proportions bar charts with error bars (CI 95%).

### [Processing Ibex Farm output](bash_processing.html)

* A description of bash script used to process the results file from an Ibex Farm experiment.

### [Eye-tracking workflow](eye-tracking-workflow.nb.html)

* Documentation for how to take .EDF files exported from [EyeTrack](https://blogs.umass.edu/eyelab/software/) and turn them into an analyzable dataset
* Includes workflow for using:
    1. fix_align_v0p92.R
    2. Robodoc.py and associated scripts
    3. SideEye (beta)
    4. Failed attempts and depricated code

### [Snail races](snail_race.nb.html)

* A quick and dirty analysis of how people respond to Twitter "snail races".
* Can be used to compensate for order effects in 4-point multiple choice questions (MCQs).
